name: Hotel Brighton

reviews.title: Stunning Views of City of Lights
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 408 in March 2007, which had unimaginable views of Paris. We could see the Eiffel Tower from the two (2) small balconies (along with the nightly light show – a trip highlight), along with the Tuileries Gardens, Louvre, Orsay, Invalides, and a ton of Paris. No kidding – this is the best view I’ve ever had in a hotel. In fact, it was overwhelming. Even my 8 year old son had to appreciate the fantastic view. The hotel was quiet, and the room was nice enough. The room was not luxurious, and neither was the hotel lobby or restaurant. There are small areas of disrepair (the steps look awful), and housekeeping was hit or miss. For instance, despite requests, a lightbulb was not replaced during our entire visit. However, the room was clean. Like most of Paris, there is no A/C, but we did not need it in March with the windows open in the afternoon. At night, the radiator heat was great, along with the towel warmer in the bathroom. The marble bathroom was fantastic and huge. The hotel is centrally located, and within walking distance of two (2) metro stops. Because of its location, not much is open late at night, but you can easily get around town from the hotel. Desk staff was nice, but uninformed and unable to provide really good advice. They were willing, though, to happily run into the street to hail us a cab in the pouring rain. Even with recent renovations, this is an old-ish hotel. However, its quiet, clean, and not expensive. I cannot emphasize this enough: whatever shortcomings this hotel has are grossly overwhelmed by the stunning views of the city. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Excellent view
reviews.text: The views and location is what sold us on this hotel. I read the reviews and as you can see from what people are saying this hotel is a nice place to stay. We booked from the web site with a price of just over $200 a night. We had the view of all the major attractions in Paris, Louvre, Jardin de Tuileries, Arch de Triomphe and the Tour Eiffel. The hotel is only one block from the Metro station, easy for getting around. The one concern that comes with the view is the noise. R. de Rivoli is a very busy street, with the weather being perfect I thought that we could sleep with the balcony doors open. That did not last long, cars going by all night. The room does have air condition but it didn't get cool enough. Not a deal breaker but some concern. The bathroom had a tub and seperate shower. A flat screen tv. The staff was helpful, we only know a little Frech. The front desk clerk told us of a nice resturant nearby L' Imperial, they spoke English. For the area and the price this was a great place to stay. One block down there is another hotel that charges over $500 a night. For what you get at this hotel, we made the right choice by staying here.

reviews.title: Great Room, Bath, Location and Views as promised
reviews.text: Our party had rooms 312 looking out on the "view" and room 102 on the "courtyard". Both rooms were junior suites. They were huge by any measure. Double sink baths were extremely nice with separate tub and shower and toilet in different closet. (In 312, the toilet was separate location from rest of bath) Great water pressure in the shower and nice large soaking tub, which can feel great after a long day of walking. The location was superb! The views just as you see on this site from candid photos. The couryard view was just looking out over the tops of some buildings below, but we really were not there that often, so it didn't matter for that room. They have two elevators - one tiny and one very suitable size. Only have two minor complaints: one is that there was no clock in the room, and the other is that the desk staff was not friendly or helpful to us. Unfortunately, Bernard, (who others have mentioned here and who was very helpful in my email communications prior to arrival) was on holiday during our stay. Despite my attempts at being very friendly and trying my best with my limited french, I was disappointed at how unhelpful they were. When we arrived, one of the rooms was not made up for the third person. I called down and the guy brought up sheets, but we had to make the bed ourselves. He explained that he was alone at the desk during that time. We also asked the location of the nearest bank and they couldn't tell us. Maybe we just caught them at an off time. I could certainly recommend this hotel for all the other positives as stated.

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.text: This is a fabulous location for an excellent price. It is a simple hotel, but the rooms are large and the views are wonderful. We could see the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Tuilleries Garden, and the Crystal Palace from our window. The only negative is that there is very limited room service, but there are so many wonderful bakeries and cafes within a couple of blocks that that's not a problem. If you need coffee or tea in your room, just be sure to take a little hot pot and tea bags or coffee bags with you. Also, don't trust the front desk to give you correct information. They told us that Versailles closed at 7:00, and gave us wrong directions to the train station. After an hour of walking and riding the train, we arrived at 4:00 to find out that it actually closed at 5:30, and there was a 45 minute wait to enter. Overall, this is a great little place for the money, and we would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great Location, Tired Decor
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Brighton last November with two friends. While the location was wonderful, our room was not. The room was large but very sparsely furnished (two single beds, a cot, a desk and a mini-fridge with a TV perched on top). The paint was peeling from the walls and the bedspreads looked less than clean. The bathroom had tiles missing, a burned out light bulb and more peeling paint. It was not a room that you would want to spend any time in other than to sleep.

I booked this hotel for my family based on a recommendation in National Geographic Traveler. I agree that the location is fun and practical if you prefer the Right Bank. The rooms are also adequate and quite roomy by Parisian standards.
reviews.title: 4-star location, 1-star service

likes.disliked: — Awful service and tired public spaces

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service, by contrast, was dreadful. A young blond woman was at the reception when we arrived in the afternoon of March 15; she shoved a form in our face as if she were a bureaucrat in the French Social Security Office. She was equally unfriendly and unhelpful the next day, though she had enough time to snicker and giggle on the phone during what appeared to be a social call with friends.
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

likes.liked: — The size of the room and the location of the hotel

reviews.text: A man named Elio was similarly hostile to us and to other guests.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC LOCATION

likes.liked: — The location and the fabulous views

reviews.text: We could barely get anyone at the hotel to make a restaurant reservation. We had no hot water at sporadic points throughout our 4-day stay; although the hotel sent an apology bottle of champagne, they never fixed the problem.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most 4-star hotels in Paris have a concierge, or at least top-notch front-desk staff. This one was a service disaster.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable hotel

reviews.text: This was the perfect hotel for our trip to Paris. I am very picky about hotels.... I search far and wide for reviews of hotels before I book them... I researched Hotel Brighton extensively before I booked the rooms ....... And I have to say I was not disappointed. The location was perfect. The views were absolutely breathtaking , the hotel was clean, large for a Paris hotel and beautifully appointed. One of our rooms had a king size bed and sofa and the other had 2 twinbeds and sofabed. Both rooms had large bathrooms with separate shower and tub. While it is true that the traffic outside is quite loud, it did not bother me or my mother in law and we are both light sleepers..... I think the view absolutely outweighs the traffic noise....
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, Perfect location, Amazing Views

reviews.text: My family of six(4 adults and 2 kids) stayed in 2 junior suites(Rm 308 and 410....308 was more beautiful by the way) from June 17-22. Both of our rooms had small balconies with views of the Louvre, the Tuileries Gardens, Musee D'Orsay and the Eiffel Tower. It was so amazing to get back home at the end of the day and still continue to enjoy the beauty of Paris from the privacy of our bedrooms. The sparkling Eiffel Tower was an amazing sight. I tried to capture it with my camera but it did not do it justice...it is definitely a sight to behold.
reviews.title: terrible hotel

reviews.text: The location was absolutely perfect...It is 2 doors away from Paris Vision if you want to take their tours, 5 minutes walk from the Louvre and The L'Open tour bus stop, 10 minutes walk from the Musee D' Orsay( through the Tuileries Garden and across the Seine )and 8 minute walk to the Place de la Concorde....There were several restaurants nearby, our favorite of which was L'Imperial and a small Italian restaurant (I don't remember the name ) which was recommended by Bernard... We ate at the Au Dauphin one night but that was very expensive, we paid about $294.00 for the 6 of us but the food was good....
reviews.title: View, Price Location, and Service, this is the place to stay!

likes.disliked: — hand held shower and price of internet and breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot end my review without saying something about the staff... We have stayed in Paris before and we know that the Parisians could sometimes be haughty...but this was not the case at Hotel Brighton... everyone was very nice and attentive to our needs... particularly the older guy who serves breakfast....unfortunately I did not get his name but he was always so attentive to our family when we were there....
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: By the way for those who are unsure about taking an open Bus tour. It was a great way to see the lay of the land on our first day in Paris .... My 2 kids 11 and 13 loved it ... We took the L'Open tour bus because their bus stop was closer to our hotel, but I did notice that the Les Car Rouges seemed to have better bus stops by the Tourist attractions(I noticed this at Notre Dame,Eiffel Tower and Musee D'Orsay).....
reviews.title: Walk to Everything
Fantastic!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Brighton for my 30th birthday in April. It was everything I hoped it would be and more. The views were spectacular. I highly recommend spending a little bit more to have the views, it is beyond worth it. Especially at night when the Louvre gets illuminated like a storybook castle and every hour on the hour the Eiffel Tower sparkles for 10 minutes. You will find yourself mesmerized by the sights over and over again.

likes.disliked: — Can not think of a single bad thing to say!

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the city and we got some great restaurant recommendations from them.
reviews.title: Great Location
Perfect!
reviews.text: Other reviews say that it is in a tourist area and therefore nothing good to eat is around, I highly disagree. All you have to do is walk 1 block away from the gardens and there are a slew of local, small restaurants that are wonderful.

The only complaint, although a small one, is that the "Do not Disturb" sign doesn't get much attention from the housekeeping staff. If you leave it up during the day they will knock and come in anyway. If you do not want your room cleaned, let the front desk know. Otherwise, the housekeepers will go in.
reviews.title: Hotel Brighton view? Priceless!
Great place to stay in Paris
reviews.text: I stayed at the Brighton from May 5 to May 20.I had a junior suite on the third floor facing le Jardin des Tuileries.The view was great.The location is perfect.The room was clean and quiet with a lot of space.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: It was our first time in Paris and we had only three days to explore it so we chose the hotel very carefully and this hotel was our number one choice because of the perfect location: many city attractions are within a walking distance. And the views from our room facing the Tuileries garden were just fabulous: Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Tour Montparnasse, Eglise du Dome and the ultimate Paris symbol - Tour Eiffel. You will admire all of this before you go to bed and when you wake up if you choose to stay at Hotel Brighton!!!

reviews.title: Spectacular views, beautiful room
reviews.text: We had room 411 (on the 4th/roof floor). It was rather small but comfy. The bathroom had a bath. The staff was very okay, too. By the way, the famous Cafe Angelina is just a few doors away. We had one of our breakfasts there (but that's another story!). The point is - if you live in the heart of the city, there's no much use to have your breakfast in the hotel. Instead you should go out and have your Parisian breakfast somewhere nearby.

reviews.title: brighton hotel best value in area
reviews.text: Metro stations Tuileries and Concorde (Line 1) are best for further travels by Metro.

reviews.title: Great hotel, recommended
reviews.text: Unforgettable stay. Can confirm other positive reviews. Stunning view of the Tuilleries and Eiffel Tower. Minutes walk from the Louvre. Very reasonable rates considering the location and views. Very attractive room/decor, beamed ceiling, flat screen TV. Breakfast is not included in the rate so there is no need to take it in the hotel. We tried it one day and it was average but as good as some of the nearby restaurants/cafes. One drawback, no tea or coffee making factilies in the room - have to go out for hot drinks. But overall, highly recommended!

reviews.title: Amazing views and lovely staff. Get room 409!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Brighton hotel and had a very spacious room overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre, they were renovating at the time but that was no problem, I have stayed at the Brighton hotel once before and had a lovely room then, when we read the terrible review from the Melbourne family dated the 11th july 2005 I thought they were discribing another hotel The reception people are very helpful and efficent. The person they were refering as a" Red Head "........ was very helpful and well mannered when we were there. The hotel is in one the most expensive area's in Paris. Hotels such as The Crillion, The Ritz to name a just a few, most are much more expensive then the Brighton. As for parking, hIring a car in Paris is not a good idea, it is much better to catch a cab, or to use the metro. All I can say is some people find fault with everything, and maybe their attitude has something to do with how other people react to them. I can honestly say a smile and good manners are a great help when travelling or for that matter in life, you only get what you give-out ......all in all the Brighton is a good choice with very spacious rooms, efficent staff and in a very good area. What more do you want for a wonderful stay in Paris

We (two couples) stayed at the Brighton for 2 nights 20/21st June, last weekend. You cannot fault this gem. The location is perfect, just opposite the Jardin des Tuileries and within 5 minutes walk of The Louvre, Concorde & Place Vendome. In addition the metro across the road will take you very quickly to any other destination in Paris.
reviews.title: Simply Brilliant, Brilliantly Simple

likes.liked: — Location, Cleanliness, Comfortable Room, Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is basic in amenities so if you need all the bells and whistles then look elsewhere but in terms of having a very comfortable base from which to explore Paris in the knowledge that on your return you can relax in reasonable comfort then the Brighton is perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect for a weekend break

reviews.text: Reception staff are very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The rooms while not massive are of a good size with a fine bathroom (double sink) and good size double bed. Better than average storage space is provided along with a free safe in your room. Our room overlooked the courtyard but as we spend little time in our hotel rooms this made no difference to us - if you insist on a view then perhaps ask for a room to the front.
reviews.title: Made a good choice in this hotel!

likes.disliked: — some noise from elevator at our room

reviews.text: Rooms were made up both days and fresh towels provided. My only minor gripe would be that our shower fitting did not attach to the wall (although our friends one did) but this does not detract from the very pleasant experience we had. I would return no problem and would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Awesome location, Comfy Beds, Great Views & Tiny Lift!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and another couple stayed here for two nights in March 2008. It's location is second to none. Many of the key attractions are within walking distance (eg. Louvre, Musee D'Orsay) and a well-connected Metro station is 2 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I lived in Paris for two years, so when we go back we usually stay in apartments. This time, we had only two nights so decided to stay in a hotel. The Brighton has been recommended to me and I had inspected it when I lived in Paris, so knew exactly what to expect.
reviews.title: Incredible position - you know you are in Paris!

reviews.text: It really is one of the best located hotels in Paris for the price. For more than double you can stay at the Meurice only a few doors up and stay in a much smaller room (though admittedly more luxurious). But, remember, you are in Paris - you won't spend all your time in your room! Having said that, our room was huge - big king size bed, large armoire, plenty of space, two windows and a narrow balcony running the entire length of the large room. The bathroom had twin basins, a separate shower and bath, and a separate toilet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Fabulous Location

reviews.text: I choose a large room with a balcony on the fourth floor to ensure that we would be high enough to see over the trees of the Tuileries and to enjoy the incredible view. And incredible it is -you are opposite the Tuileries Gardens, with Musee D'Orsay in the background - the Louvre to the left, the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe on the right. We absolutely loved it and you definitely know you are in the heart of Paris at such a fabulous location. We skipped the hotel breakfast and went over to the gardens to have breakfast from the Paul patisserie cart at the Louvre end. They have tables set up with a coffee machine - superb!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful. We had huge amounts of luggage and the porter was great. All very couteous, friendly and welcoming. No negative experiences at all. But, do ask for a high room with a balcony - so much nicer being about to step outside to feel Paris and well as see it.
reviews.title: A Paris gem

reviews.text: And did I mention the location???? Opposite the Tuileries metro stop, so if you can't walk somewhere, just jump on a metro. Also, there were always plenty of taxis available.
reviews.title: Very agreeable central stay
great location, watch your belongings
reviews.text: The view is great (if you have a room facing the Tuileries). But watch your belongings. A significant amount of cash disappeared from my bag while stored for an afternoon in their baggage room. Management was less than helpful. Blamed me for leaving cash in the bag. Did not propvide any assistance - like contacting police. Management seems to think stealing is OK if the opportunity is there.
A tripadvisor member
reviews.title: Clean room with great views

likes.disliked: — A few more cafe's with the locals.

reviews.text: New York City
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: May 5th, 2008
reviews.title: Great location, not so great service

likes.liked: — It's location and close proximity to many main tourist sites

reviews.text: A friend of mine and I recently stayed at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location near the Louvre and the Tuilleries. We were greeted by two hotel desk employees who were very pleasant and helpful. We requested a high floor and two double beds which we received without any problems. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful as they assisted in organizing a private car hire to the Champagne region for the day. The staff made all of the phone calls and even compared prices with a few private car services. My friend and I did a little "price investigating" out on our own and when we returned back to the hotel for the private car hire search results, the staff was able to secure a car that was much cheaper than we could find with a very knowledgeable driver. We definitely enjoyed the hotel. It was incredibly clean. The beds were firm. The bathroom was a decent size. The views of the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre were amazing.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location!

likes.liked: — the room size and view from the balcony
likes.disliked: — staff wasn't rude, but wasn't very friendly either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of its closeness to Paris Vision for the excursions we planned. The location is excellent! We asked for a quiet room and in #401 we got it! By Canadian standards ($295.00) a night, it was expensive but Paris is expensive! Unlike Canada, there was no coffee maker in the room; a continental breakfast was not included. Willing to pay the price, you can not beat the location! Close to the Louvre Museum made it worth it! The early morning staff member, Pierre, was most helpful and kind in booking Eurostar for us, when our flight did not come through for us! (because of the Dust cloud/ origin Iceland)
reviews.title: A hotel near Paris Vision for excursions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for the location wich is really extremely convinient. I wasn't expecting much. My God what a nice surprise!
reviews.title: Excellent surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, we arrived at 10am and were sure that the room wouldn't be ready before 2pm. Well it was ready and it's so good to take a shower after 11h in a plane!
reviews.title: What a view!!!!

reviews.text: The room was on the 4th floor, #409. Amazing view, probably the best in Paris. The tuileries and the Louvre in front of you, the Eiffel tower on the right.
reviews.title: Wow! View of Eiffel Tower and the Louvre!

reviews.text: Room was an executive, very big, huge bathroom, very comfortable and with a small balcony! Nice staff, cosy decoration.
reviews.title: Brilliant location
Fantastic Views
reviews.text: Stayed in Hotel Brighton from 7th Jan to 11th. Had done lots of research and wanted something close to Metro and with a view. tall order i thought, but all reviews of this hotel looked good, Emailed them and got very prompt response, no problems, asked for room with view and whata view it was. Lourve to left, Jardin de Tulieries directly in front and Eiffel Tower to right. Perfect location, 100 yards from Metro (Line 1). If you look at Photo 1, just above the middle spike on the railing, you can se the metro station.

reviews.title: Magical
reviews.text: Friendly staff, nice room, not massive but in fairness we didn't book the hotel to stay in the room for 4 days. Would definitely stay here again. Ask for room with view!!! Its worth it.

reviews.title: Great Location and Best View in Paris ( Ifel tower, Tulleries, Panteon etc)
reviews.text: Before booking our first trip to Paris I did my research to find the perfect hotel for our stay. Now, when you go to Paris for the first time, you hope to see the twinkle of the Eiffel Tower from your hotel room window, and I can confirm that the Hotel Brighton does not disappoint - absolutely magical!

reviews.title: Central location, shame about the rooms
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Brighton in April 06. After reading a number of reviews prior to our visit I specifically requested room 511 (I have attached photos). Upon arrival we found a beautiful room, adequately sized (very French), and two small balconies that overlooked the Tuileries Garden and the Louvre to the left, and the Eiffel Tower to the right. We were very happy with the room, especially the view (despite the scaffolding which obstructed our view of the Eiffel Tower), and all aspects of the hotel.

reviews.title: Fantastic location, excellent room, helpful Concierge
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and very helpful. Prior to arriving, I emailed the hotel to request they organise all our dinner and lunch reservations (i.e. Moulin Rouge, Jules Verne Restaurant, Bateaux Parisiens - the dinner cruise on the River Seine in a glass top boat; all the touristy things for first time visitors.). The staff were very helpful and easy to communicate with (considering I speak no French). They had no problems carrying out my requests and our reservations were perfect.

I had not been to Paris prior to this visit. I had heard the general issues of poor service, uncaring staff and communication problems. The Hotel Brighton is the exact opposite of anything that you have or will hear. The hotel itself is exceptional. Perfectly located for any activity and has the most marvelous views of Paris. It is clean, classic style and is an excellent place to stay. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and very service oriented. They are attentive and provide the utmost in guest care. If you are planning your first visit or a return trip and have not stayed at the Hotel Brighton, I would highly recommend it to any and all travelers.
reviews.title: Absolutely Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best deal in Paris, with the best views. We had an executive room on the top floor with balcony and views that almost made you not want to leave the room! The hotel was extremely cozy and quaint, with the perfect French ambiance that really added to the romance. We watched the Eiffel Tower light show from our balcony every night while enjoying a bottle of wine before bed. I arranged the VIP welcome with flowers and champagne. The Roses were beautiful and the champagne and treats were the perfect way to start our trip. The management and staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They even helped us out with a 110 American to 220 European conversion plug for our laptop. Then upon check out they let us buy it for 20 Euro to use on the rest of our trip through Europe! That saved the day, because the converter we had bought prior to our trip blew up about 30 seconds after plugging it in! They all spoke English very well and were eager to help us with all our questions.
reviews.title: Best views in Paris, the Louvre, Tuileries Gardens and Eiffel Tower!!
Honeymoon in Paris
reviews.text: I got married on 31 Dec 2009 and decided to go Paris in winter for my honeymoon. The room rates in Paris are astronomically high compared with those in Singapore. So I had to 'settle' for Hotel Brighton after much research.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed by the small lobby initially but the reception at the front desk was terrific. They spoke English and were very warm and helpful. When we finally got to our room, it was nothing like the 5-star suites we can get for the same price here but it was cosy and distinctly Parisienne. The staff had also surprised us with a box of Godiva chocolates as our honeymoon present!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, last-minute booking

reviews.text: We stayed there for 5 nights and the charm of the room and the hotel grew so much on us. The view of the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre garden was amazing and even though it was freezing, my wife and I enjoyed staying outside the small balcony and look at the occassional crazy jogger willing to brave the cold to exercise.
reviews.title: View! View! Did I mention the VIEW!!!!

reviews.text: yes, breakfast at the Maeurice Hotel is more than a night at the Brighton Hotel... we were impressed with the location, location, location at an affordable price!!!!
reviews.title: WOW, we stayed next door to The Maeurice Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One would think a room facing the rue Rivoli would be awesome...but we were lucky to have a room in the back to avoid the buzz from the street. Our room size was okay of adequate size...not too small. Catching the metro was convenient. The staff was friendly! We preferred to dine out for breakfast.
reviews.title: AMAZING! THE PERFECT HOTEL FOR A FIRST TRIP TO PARIS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend everyone who is visiting Paris for the first time stay at Hotel Brighton. We stayed in an Executive Room and paid in advance (Esprit Premium Plus deal) and received a huge discount. The room (on the fourth floor) was AMAZING, there is no other way to describe it. The bathroom was as big as most hotel rooms, then there was a separate sitting room and the bed and two "balconies" (just be warned they are not big balconies but just big enough to stand on). What makes this room is the view. You have an uninterrupted view of the Eiffel tower in the distance, (which you can see from your bed), the Louvre to your left and the Tuileries right in front of view. Note that there are two elevators, one that you can fit in with your luggage (further from reception) and one that I will call "romantic".
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the perfect location for a first time visit to Paris. There is a bus 100m from the hotel (walk outside and turn right) that takes you to the Eiffel Tower (#72) but apart from that you can walk everywhere. Private car to the airport should cost 40 - 45 EUR. If the hotel books it will cost 60 EUR so book yourself if you can.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel... Except for the BEDS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While you are here go to Angelina's for a hot chocolate. It is around 50m from the hotel. If the budget allows (and it is a special occasion) have dinner in the Eiffel Tower (58 Tour Eiffel). Apart from the novelty of having dinner in the Eiffel Tower, the food was incredible.
reviews.title: Depends on what you're looking for...

reviews.text: I've been to Brighton a few times the last years, and after this stay I've decided that this was my last stay here.
reviews.title: Brilliant location - but overpriced and bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with the good things, the location of the hotel is superb. If you book a room which has a view on the Jardin de Tuileries, Louvre, Tour Eiffel sights are astonishing. Across the street there is the Tuilleries metro station which is very convenient.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Over the last few year I have seen the prices of this hotel rise, while service is getting worst. The rooms are very average (apart from the view), the beds are not very good (and did not seem very crisp&clean) and the pillows are very bad (too soft and no extra pillows in the closet). There are no coffee making facilities, no room service with hot meals, Wifi wasn't available in my room, etc. Breakfast is average as well, but overpriced (€19), better get a breakfast at some of the many restaurants located near (I can recommend Le Pain Quotidien at place du Marché St. Honoré)
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is not what you might expect for this price, people at the reception disinterested in their guests, hardly watching and greeting when you come in. I had to find my luggage myself in the luggage storing facility because the porter could not find it (while it was tagged with a label with a number on it..)
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What made me finally decide not to return to this hotel is that they charged me more that €50,- too much per night while checking out - when I mentioned this, the price was changed right away without checking my original booking or making any apologies. This made me feel a bit like they are trying to rip off every guest.
reviews.title: Fabulous location

description: The Hotel Brighton is one of the most romantic hotels in the heart of Paris. Built in 1830 by Lord Egerton, the Brighton ranks among the oldest hotels in Paris. Entirely renovated, this charming hotel is located on the Rue de Rivoli, facing the Tuileries Garden, and only one step from the Louvre and Orsay Museums, the Opera House, the Concorde and Madeleine Places and the river Seine.
